content.question: The definite integral <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is approximated by a left Riemann sum, a right Riemann sum, and a trapezoidal sum, each with <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> subintervals of equal width. If <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the value of the left Riemann sum, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the value of the right Riemann sum, and <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the value of the trapezoidal sum, which of the following inequalities is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="L is less than the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x, which is less than T, which is less than R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo><</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="L is less than T, which is less than the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x, which is less than R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo><</mo><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="R is less than the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x, which is less than T, which is less than L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo><</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="R is less than T, which is less than the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x, which is less than L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo><</mo><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>L</mi></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L is less than T, which is less than the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the square root of x, end root, d x, which is less than R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>L</mi><mo><</mo><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo><</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
